projects.title: C++ Snippets
projects.desc: Repository of beginner-targeted C++ programs. Covers topics from basic programming logic and C/C++ syntax.

projects.title: Java Snippets
projects.desc: Repository of beginner-targeted Java programs. Covers topics from basic programming logic and Java syntax and semantics, as well as a bit of OOP.

projects.title: Project: Awsm RPG
projects.desc: An ambitious one-man indie RPG being developed in C#/SFML.Net from scratch. Blog contains dev news, updates and preview media.

projects.title: Numerical Integration
projects.desc: Made for a class homework in a Numerical Methods course. A JavaScript application of two numerical integration methods, namely the Trapezoidal Rule and Left/Right Endpoint Approximation. Comes with a bit of jQuery too I guess.

projects.title: RPG Calculator
projects.desc:
Made to curb a mathcraft/theorycraft nerd's OCD tendencies. A convenient way to compute various RPG statistics, such as HP and EXP.

Dunno exactly what other people would use this for, but eh, I'll put it up anyways.

projects.title: Omega Calculator
projects.desc:
Made out of frustration from playing too much Chocobo's Dungeon 2. A quick and dirty way to determine how many 'Empty Bottles' are needed to acquire Omega Essence from the boss of the same name.

The tool itself was crudely coded in a rush within a few minutes, so excuse the appearance.

projects.title: Coding Styles Page
projects.desc:
My first attempt at dabbling with flat design. Made from scratch without images. Also serves as a personal (yet public) reference to the semantic coding styles I adhere to.

Currently only contains C++ coding styles, but I'll add styles for other languages (eventually).

projects.title: Class Schedule
projects.desc: A minor Javascript experiment involving tooltips, and a minor CSS experiment involving image-less design.

projects.title: CSS Zen Garden Sample
projects.desc:
An attempt at joining the CSS Zen Garden. The submission wasn't accepted (the site wasn't being actively updated when I tried to submit, but meh), but I still view this as a decent XHTML/CSS2 learning experience.

Now that the CSS Zen Garden site is updated (there's a GitHub repo now!), I'll probably try to re-do an HTML5/CSS3 version.
